description: Dew, of unknown meaning and origin, + Old English læppa (“a loose hanging piece”)

entries.meaning: The pendulous skin under the neck of an ox, or a similar feature on any other animal.
examples: Fire burst from its open mouth, its eyes glowed with a smouldering glare, its muzzle and hackles and dewlap were outlined in flickering flame.

entries.meaning: The sagging flesh on the throat of an elderly human.
